medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent fever, drenching night sweats, reduced appetite, and left upper abdominal pain exacerbated by inspiration.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 week prior to presentation, with intermittent fever and abdominal pain worsening on inspiration. No weight loss, cough, or respiratory symptoms were reported. The patient had a previous episode of fever lasting 12 weeks eight years previously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Positive antinuclear antibody test at a low titer and previous treatment with oral glucocorticoids, which resolved symptoms. No current medications.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of aggressive natural killer cell leukemia. No family history of autoimmune or clotting disorders.
medical_history.social_history: Born in the UK to Indian parents, living in London with his wife, works as a management consultant, travels to India occasionally (last trip 4 years ago), never smoked, minimal alcohol intake, no known risk factors for HIV infection.
